executive_summary: Over the five years to 2022, the Pasta Sauce Production industry has struggled to generate significant growth prospects, as an increasing proportion of domestic consumers focus on healthier dietary options. Furthermore, a significant increase in import products over the current five-year period is expected to heighten price-based competition for an already highly competitive domestic industry. Conversely, increasing trade value in the US dollar, measured by the trade-weighted index (TWI), has precipitated a contraction in industry export revenue, as domestically produced sauces become more expensive in international markets. As a result, IBISWorld expects total industry revenue to decline at an annualized rate of 1.4% over the past five years, totaling $6.3 billion in 2022. Moreover, industry revenue is expected to decline 0.1% in 2022 alone. During the same five-year period, industry profit, measured as earnings before interest and taxes, is anticipated to decrease, totaling 5.5% of average revenue in 2022.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Industry encompasses manufacturers of tomato-based, cream-based and vegetable-based sauces
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The Pasta Sauce Production industry encompasses manufacturers of tomato-based, cream-based and vegetable-based sauces within the United States. Industry products are highly established and have long been considered a household staple among domestic consumers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Demand influenced by economic climate, trade, and consumer sentiment
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Demand for pasta sauces is influenced by a variety of factors. In terms of the broader economic climate, fluctuation in consumer confidence affects demand, as prepackaged sauces and complimentary products are typically less expensive than dining out. Similarly, the trade value of the US dollar dictates the proportion of domestic demand satisfied by imported foreign substitutes, while also influencing export revenue for industry operators. Finally, consumer sentiment toward health-conscious dietary options has increased in recent years, forcing many operators to develop new product lines to attract consumers.

Overall, IBISWorld expects total industry revenue to decline at an annualized rate of 1.4% over the past five years, totaling $6.3 billion in 2022. Moreover, industry revenue is expected to decline 0.1% in 2022 alone.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Marginal revenue increase expected over next 5 years
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Following the coronavirus pandemic, industry revenue is expected to slightly contract in 2021 and 2022 and increase marginally over the five years to 2027 as demand from downstream markets decelerates and health-conscious consumers' purchase decisions persist. Furthermore, as the domestic economy recovers from the pandemic's economic fallout, resurgence in demand for restaurants is expected to taper industry growth prospects, as fewer consumers opt for homecooked meals.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Decline in trade-weighted index to offset losses
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Still, any substantial revenue losses are forecast to be slightly offset by an anticipated decrease in the TWI, enabling domestic producers to generate more revenue from exports. Thus, IBISWorld expects total industry revenue to increase at an annualized rate of a mere 0.4% over the five years to 2027, totaling $6.4 billion.

industry_definition: Pasta sauce is used in pasta dishes, on pizza and other foods to flavor and moisten the dish. Pasta sauce can be made of a vegetable base, a cream base (such as milk or cheese) or an oil base.
key_trends: Fluctuation in consumer confidence affects demand, as industry products are typically less expensive than dining out
Operators have benefited from an uptick in stockpiling within grocery stores and supermarkets during the pandemic
The healthy eating index is expected to increase, tapering revenue growth for many industry operators
Decelerating demand from markets is forecast to taper revenue growth prospects
Increasing demand for restaurants tapers industry product purchases, as more consumers opt for dining experiences over homecooked meals
An expected decline in the value of the US dollar is anticipated to slightly bolster revenue growth
While general trends remain negative, the COVID-19 outbreak has provided a unique opportunity for industry operators

market_segmentation.segment_description: As the largest market for Pasta Sauce Production industry products, food service establishments are expected to account for 42.4% of revenue in 2022. This segment includes restaurants, food service contractors and caterers, as well as other operators in the food service and hospitality sector.

Retailers, such as grocery stores and supermarkets, are estimated to account for 19.2% of industry revenue in 2022, representing the second-largest market for industry goods. This segment includes large grocery store chains that have supply contracts with industry operators that can minimize additional costs often incurred through wholesalers.

Grocery wholesalers are expected to account for 17.8% of industry revenue in 2022, representing the third-largest market for pasta sauce. Wholesalers purchase pasta sauce from industry producers to supply to downstream retailers, such as restaurants, supermarkets and grocery stores.

Exports are estimated to account for 13.1% of revenue in 2022, down from 13.8% in 2017. Exports comprise a relatively low share of revenue as many sauce producers often cater to more local markets to minimize transportation and distribution costs.

Food manufacturers are estimated to account for the remaining 7.5% of industry revenue in 2022. This segment includes manufactures that assemble ready-to-eat meals, meal kit services and frozen food producers.

products_and_services.product_description: Tomato-based sauces, such as marinara and Bolognese, generate the largest portion of Pasta Sauce Production industry revenue.
Cream-based sauces, including alfredo sauce, are expected to account for 40.4% of industry revenue.
Other sauces, including oil- and vegetable-based sauces, are expected to account for the remaining 19.0% of industry revenue.

tier_1_suppliers: Fruit & Nut Farming in the US
Fruit & Vegetable Wholesaling in the US
Margarine & Cooking Oil Processing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Food Service Contractors in the US
Accommodation and Food Services in the US
Baking Mix & Prepared Food Production in the US
Soft Drink, Baked Goods & Other Grocery Wholesaling in the US
Supermarkets & Grocery Stores in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand for the Pasta Sauce Production industry is influenced by a variety of factors, including consumer preferences, disposable income levels and product innovation. In general, improvement in the overall economic environment and growth in disposable income levels lead to an increase in demand for industry sauces. However, some growth in disposable income may encourage consumers to purchase more premium brands or opt to eat out at restaurants.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Imported goods are expected to satisfy 11.4% of domestic demand for the Pasta Sauce Production industry in 2022, representing an increase from 8.4% in 2017. While the industry has been a historic net exporter, overarching trends have begun shifting trade balances in favor of foreign substitutes over the five years to 2022.
As a result, IBISWorld expects export revenue to increase at an annualized rate of a mere 0.3% over the past five years, totaling $945.4 million in 2022.

business_locations.location_description: In 2022, IBISWorld estimates that 26.7% of industry establishments are located in the West region. California alone holds an estimated 16.1% of total pasta sauce producers. This is largely due to the proximity to key suppliers and farms, as California's favorable climate makes it a leading producer of fruits.

The Great Lakes region is estimated to hold 17.6% of industry establishments. Wisconsin is the most concentrated state within the region, accounting for an estimated 4.6% of total industry establishments. This region is close in proximity to the industry's leading export market, Canada, making it a desirable location for industry operators with substantial export markets.

The Southeast region is expected to account for 17.9% of industry establishments with Florida being the most concentrated, holding 3.8% of total industry establishments. Operators in this region benefit from proximity to key producers of fruit and vegetables due to the favorable climate and soil conditions.

Other regions tend to fall relatively in line with the overall population, thus key downstream domestic markets. The Mid-Atlantic is estimated to hold 13.5% of industry establishments and 15.0% of the US population. This region is most heavily concentrated in New York, which holds 6.3% of total industry establishments and its 6.0% of the US population provides a large market for industry products.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The FDA regulates food processing industries through acts like the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act, requiring clear product labeling, nutrition information, and regulation of claims made by food processors.
The industry is subject to environmental regulations from the EPA and state governments, such as the Clean Water Act and Clean Air Act, regarding wastewater treatment and waste disposal.
During the pandemic, manufacturing facilities had to follow OSHA regulations to protect employee health and safety, like encouraging sick workers to stay home and maintaining social distancing.

barriers_points.barrier_title: Scale of production determines capital and labor requirements
barriers_points.barrier_description: The scale of production determines the level of capital and labor required to be successful in the industry. New entrants must be able to produce enough pasta sauce to reduce production costs.

barriers_points.barrier_title: Brand recognition of large players is a challenge
barriers_points.barrier_description: One of the most significant challenges for new entrants is brand recognition of the industry's largest players like Prego which benefits from brand recognition, brand loyalty and extensive distribution networks.

barriers_points.barrier_title: Securing contracts and distribution networks is difficult
barriers_points.barrier_description: New entrants must be able to secure contracts and extensive distribution networks with downstream buyers to gain recognition on shelves which tend to be difficult to secure.

basis_points.basis_description: Operators within the industry compete primarily on the basis of price, particularly for end market consumers who are more likely to purchase lower-price sauces if other factors are the same.
Operators compete on quality since sauces are often the dominant flavor. Product innovation and differentiation like creating sauces with value-added ingredients is also a key source of competition.
The industry competes externally with imports, the Canned Fruit and Vegetable industry as consumers move towards making their own sauces, and fresh produce used as sauce ingredients.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Top 3 players account for 27.5% market share
concentration_points.concentration_description: The top three players in the industry account for just 27.5% of industry revenue in 2022, indicating a low level of market share concentration.
Some larger companies like Mizkan have been able to expand market share through strategic acquisitions of brands like Ragu and Bertolli.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages expenses are estimated to account for 9.7% of revenue in 2022, representing an increase from an estimated 9.2% in 2017. Over the past five years, however, the total value of industry wages is forecast to decline slightly at an annualized rate of 0.4%.

As a manufacturing industry, input purchases represent the single largest expense category, accounting for an estimated 50.3% of average revenue in 2022. Purchase costs are dependent on many factors, including product type, scale of production and proximity to appropriate farmers, among others.
Depreciation on property and relevant equipment in the industry is expected to account for 3.5% of average revenue in 2022, representing a slight increase from 3.2% in 2017.
Marketing and advertising related costs are expected to account for 0.7% of average industry revenue in 2022, representing no material change over the past five years.
Rent expenses for the Pasta Sauce Production industry are expected to account for 0.8% of average revenue in 2022, representing no change during the five-year period.
Industry utility costs are anticipated to account for 0.6% of revenue in 2022, representing a mere 0.1% decline from 2017.

Other miscellaneous industry costs include overhead expenses, such as logistics and distribution, administrative expenses and research and development (R&D) costs, among others. Overall, this category is expected to account for 29.9% of average industry revenue in 2022.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: On the mass-production end, capital investments typically encompass the wide variety of machinery and equipment necessary for processing input ingredients into marketable final products.
In 2022, industry operators are expected to allocate $0.26 toward capital expenditures for every $1.00 spent on labor.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Over the past five years, increasing import penetration has reduced demand for domestic producers. IBISWorld expects the proportion of domestic demand satisfied by imported goods to increase from 8.4% in 2017 to reach 11.4% in 2022, tapering industry revenue growth.

The COVID-19 (coronavirus) outbreak positively affected industry demand as consumers opted for the lengthier shelf lives of processed grocery items. IBISWorld expects industry revenue to increase 1.3% in 2020 alone due to the pandemic.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The industry has increasingly incorporated automation into facilities to improve product quality while reducing reliance on labor. Advanced machinery is used for sorting, washing, peeling, inspecting and crushing ingredients.
Improvements in packaging methods like retort packaging are important sources of efficiency gains for pasta sauce producers, enhancing sterilization and preservation.

FAQs.question: How is your company affected by rising imports?
FAQs.answer: Rising imports will typically increase price-based competition within the industry, which can negatively affect both bottom-line profit and overall demand.

FAQs.question: Has your company expanded product lines or do you specialize in a particular offering?
FAQs.answer: Product innovation, such as the introduction of organically produced or health-conscious products, can help capture revenue from previously untapped consumer demographics.

FAQs.question: How does your company mitigate against volatility in input prices?
FAQs.answer: In periods of increasing input prices, operators may either pass higher costs downstream through increased product prices or absorb the costs at the expense of profit.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored the possibility of acquisitions, mergers or strategic partnerships?
FAQs.answer: Consolidation within the industry is common and enables larger operators to expand product portfolios, enhance production facilities and penetrate previously untapped geographic markets.

FAQs.question: What security measures does your company take to safeguard proprietary information?
FAQs.answer: Protecting pasta sauce recipes, especially among mass-producers, are essential to the company's success, since the quality of the product is dependent on distinct balances of temperature, ingredients and viscosity.

FAQs.question: Has your company implemented or sought to implement automation within production facilities?
FAQs.answer: Wage costs represent the second-largest industry expense category. While automated production systems may represent significant upfront investments, cost savings from reduced labor can benefit an operator in the long-term.

FAQs.question: How does your company stay ahead of regulations, such as standards in regards to waste disposal?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators are required to meet the Environmental Protection Agency's regulations. When the EPA adopts new regulation, there is typically a grace period for companies to adopt to the new policies.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: Major industry trade partners, such as Canada and Mexico, benefit from the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), removing import duties on industry goods.

FAQs.question: How do your company's profit margin compare to those of large, multinational competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Larger operators typically benefit from economies of scale, bolstering overall operating profit by reducing per-unit costs. This dynamic is especially prevalent in the production of sauces due to the variety and quantity of required ingredients.

FAQs.question: Do major expenses, such as purchases or wages, for your company fall above or below industry benchmark figures?
FAQs.answer: General profitability is influenced by an operator's ability to effectively reduce purchase and wage expenses.

FAQs.question: Are you able to pass costs on to customers and downstream markets? How else do you leverage economies of scale?
FAQs.answer: Pasta sauce producers can offer lower prices on industry products when made in larger quantities, since this scale enables them to reduce per-unit costs.

FAQs.question: Do you source necessary ingredients locally or through international trade? Does the supply chain seem insulated from any external disruptions, such as geopolitical issues?
FAQs.answer: Purchases represent the largest industry expense. Thus, general profitability is highly dependent on an operator's ability to manage purchase costs. Since these costs are dependent on the quality and transportation of ingredients, sourcing ingredients locally could potentially benefit an enterprise's bottom line.

FAQs.question: How do you market your products to attract consumers? Is there a particular consumer group you're aiming for? Do you try to market products based on price or quality?
FAQs.answer: Pasta sauces are highly established consumer goods, making differentiation difficult. As a result, many producers market products through value prices, specialty ingredients or favorable dietary benefits as methods of product differentiation in advertising campaigns.

FAQs.question: Do you track the value of the US dollar? Do you engage in any work with international buyers?
FAQs.answer: A declining TWI typically leads to greater demand for industry exports along with weaker import competition, overall, boosting industry revenue.

FAQs.question: Do you keep track of the consumer confidence index?
FAQs.answer: In general, industry demand is typically higher in periods of low consumer confidence since industry products are comparatively less expensive than dining out or sourcing all necessary ingredients.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor the agricultural price index? How do input prices influence your overall demand? What are your strategies to deal with difficult price conditions?
FAQs.answer: As the cost of inputs expands, manufacturers must either absorb higher costs or pass them on to downstream markets at the expense of curbing demand.
